alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 11:28AM MST until July 14 at 1:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PIPELINE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 1125 AM MST, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Burn Scar with 6 inches of water flowing along U.S. Highway 89 northeast of Flagstaff with debris also across the roadway. Avoid this area!!! Radar and rain gauges have suggested up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Government Tank Wash. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Timberline, Hutchison Acres and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 427. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... San Francisco Wash and Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Burn Scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
